conbody.p: One or more attribute key-value pairs can be specified within <attributes></attributes> tags. Each attribute must be specified within as a separate key-value pair as follows. The <attributes> tag is optional.

table.title: Attributes supported in the incoming request

entry.p: Attribute
Description
EMAIL, SMS, SOAP, REST, TCPIP, KAFKA
The key specifies the target server type and the value specifies the defined target server names.
The notification service supports multiple target servers specified in the incoming trigger request. Each target server must be specified as a separate key-value pair.

The target server name is optional. If the server name is not specified in the request or if the key name is other than the valid names (i.e., EMAIL, SMS, SOAP, REST, TCPIP, KAFKA), then the default server specified in the application preferences is used to send the notification.

If multiple target servers of the similar type are specified in the incoming request, then only one target server is used randomly. For example, if key (<key>) is 'SMS' and the values (<value>) are 'SMSSERVER1', 'SMSSERVER2', and 'SMSSERVER3' then any one SMS server is selected for sending the request.
High-priority notifications are sent directly, bypassing the frequency logic. Normal priority notifications are sent after considering the frequency logic.

Priority is an optional parameter in the incoming request. If priority is not specified in the request, or if the key name is other than the valid names, then the priority specified in the notification template is considered to send the notification.
Valid values: HIGH, NORMAL

This attribute is used for suppressing a notification. If the value for this attribute is true, the notification is not sent and is added to the EDR log. If the value is false, the notification is sent.
If notifSuppress is not specified in the request, or the value provided is other than the valid values, then the default value is false. That is, the notification is sent.
Valid values: true, false
Text

If the request contains this attribute and if the notification delivery fails for any notification channel, then NS sends an alternate SMS to the default SMPP server. The SMS contains the value specified in this attribute.

li.p: NS attempts to send the fallback SMS only once.
If the user's phone number is not configured, then fallback SMS is not sent. The message is only saved in the EDR log.
NS uses the default SmppServer to send the fallback SMS.

If multiple channels are applicable for a client request, and the notification delivery fails for one or more channels, then NS tries to send fallback SMS for each channel for which notification delivery has failed.

entry.p: Example scenario: If all retires are exhausted for sending an EMAIL notification but still NS is unable to send the notification, and if the request has fallback key and its value, then the value which is specified is used to send SMS to the default SMPP server.
Mobile number
The mobile number provided in this attribute overrides the value specified in the SMPP server for outgoing SMS.

li.p: SMS-Orig-Id is sent for the retry SMS.
SMS-Orig-Id is not sent in case of FallBack SMS.

entry.p: Using this attribute, operators can schedule the delivery of the SMS to the device with a new value provided in the incoming triggering request.
Time format should be "YYMMDDhhmmsstnnp"
where
YY: last two digits of the year (00-99)
MM: month (01-12)
hh: hour (00-23)
mm: minute (00-59)
ss: second (00-59)
t: tenth of a second (0-9)
nn: Time difference in quarter hours between local time (as provided in the first 13 letters) and UTC (Universal Time Constant) time (00-48).
p: Specifies absolute or relative delivery.

li.p: “+” indicates that the local time is nn quarter hours after the UTC time.
“-” indicates that the local time is nn quarter hours before the UTC time.
“R” indicates that local time is relative to the current SMSC server time. See for details.

conbody.p: The following attributes are also supported for specific customers. NS uses these attributes without any formatting or changes.
